docs.lead_paragraph: THE wealthy New Yorkers who have country seals among the picturesque hills and valleys of Westchester County go in for a form of diversion which is probably unique among the country club "sets" of the United States. There are devotees of polo in Westchester County, just as there are at Lakewood and West bury and other places where the rich have homes.

headline.main: More Fun in Fire Fighting Than Following the Hounds; Wealthy New Yorkers Who Live in Westchester Like Nothing Better than Getting Out of Bed in the Middle of the Night and Putting Out a Fire in a Neighbor's House.
